name: Psychology
description: As part of Social and behavioural sciences, Psychology is the scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behaviour in a given context, considering individual differences, experience, and environment. [cite: 122]

name: Cognitive science
description: The interdisciplinary, scientific study of the mind and its processes, often included or closely related to Psychology. [cite: 122]

name: Psychoanalysis
description: A system of psychological theory and therapy which aims to treat mental disorders by investigating the interaction of conscious and unconscious elements in the mind, a specific school within or related to Psychology. [cite: 122]

name: Psychotherapy
description: The use of psychological methods, particularly when based on regular personal interaction, to help a person change behavior and overcome problems in desired ways, often practiced by psychologists. [cite: 122]
